question.text: Which of the following has the shortest <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math> bond?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math>

solution.text: Due to –M effect of − NO 2 and + M effect of Cl more D.B. character between C – Cl bond. So shortest bond length.
